intro: Aidia micrantha var. zenkeri, commonly known as the Zenker's aidia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers that typically bloom in clusters. The plant has simple, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in tropical gardens.
